subject: Psychology
title: Social Comparison Theory
description: A micro-lesson that makes Social Comparison Theory usable.

hook.text: You felt great about your salary until you learned your coworker earns more. Nothing changed except the comparison.

buildup.text: Leon Festinger proposed that we evaluate ourselves by comparing to others, especially when no objective standard exists.

discovery.text: Upward comparisons (to those better off) motivate but can depress. Downward comparisons boost self-esteem.

twist.text: Social media is a comparison engine. Curated highlight reels trigger constant upward comparison and dissatisfaction.

climax.text: We can't stop comparing â€” it's wired in. But awareness of the process can defuse its power.

punchline.text: You only feel behind when you pick the wrong measuring stick.

quiz.question: What does social comparison theory propose?
options: We evaluate ourselves by comparing to others
We never compare ourselves to anyone
Only children engage in social comparison
